Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is slightly ribbed and bears the remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394719) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394719)
